title: Last activity we learned about Hierarchies and introduction to inheritance. Let's answer few questions in this activity

questions.questionText: What are the parent class(es)? Note that the term "parent class" is interchangable with the term "superclass".
What are the child class(es)? Note that the term "child class" is interchangable with the term "subclass".
Which getDescription method is called when studySpell(Confundo()) is executed?

options.option: The getDescription method defined within the Spell class
options.feedback:
Incorrect
The one inside the Confundo class is called. Why? Because methods in the child class override those in the parent class if they exist in both classes.

options.option: The getDescription method defined within the Accio class
options.feedback:
Incorrect
The one inside the Confundo class is called. Why? Because methods in the child class override those in the parent class if they exist in both classes.

options.option: The getDescription method defined within the Confundo class correct
options.feedback:
Correct
The one inside the Confundo class is called. Why? Because methods in the child class override those in the parent class if they exist in both classes.
